main event: Multiple military personnel reported sightings of unidentified aerial objects in Korea during August 1954, including a meteor shower on August 2 and a bright circular object on August 8.
interesting points: One USMC pilot reported a whitish object approximately 25 feet in diameter that changed course and accelerated rapidly., An experienced pilot described a circular metallic object at about 25,000 feet making an abrupt maneuver., Three pilots observed a silver round object about 30 feet in diameter making a sudden 90-degree turn., A bright object was observed over Pyongyang, moving at a very high speed and making sharp turns., The sightings were confirmed by separate observers and sometimes supported by radar tracking.
sighted object: unidentified aerial objects, including a bright circular object and a meteor shower
witness description: US Air Force pilots and military personnel
